properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS configuration. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new AS configuration.

properties.name: scaling_configuration_name
properties.description: • scaling_configuration_name - (Required) The name of the AS configuration. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-), and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: instance_config
properties.description: • instance_config - (Required) The information about instance configurations. The instance_config dictionary data structure is documented below.
The instance_config block supports:

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Optional) When using the existing instance specifications as the template to create AS configurations, specify this argument. In this case, flavor, image, and disk arguments do not take effect. If the instance_id argument is not specified, flavor, image, and disk arguments are mandatory.

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Optional) The flavor ID.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (Optional) The image ID.

properties.name: disk
properties.description: • disk - (Optional) The disk group information. System disks are mandatory and data disks are optional. The dick structure is described below.

properties.name: key_name
properties.description: • key_name - (Required) The name of the SSH key pair used to log in to the instance.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance. The file content must be encoded with Base64.

properties.name: personality
properties.description: • personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure is described below.

properties.name: public_ip
properties.description: • public_ip - (Optional) The elastic IP address of the instance. The public_ip structure is described below.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from within the instance.
The disk block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The disk size. The unit is GB. The system disk size ranges from 40 to 32768, and the data disk size ranges from 10 to 32768.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Required) The disk type, which must be the same as the disk type available in the system. The options include SATA (common I/O disk type) and SSD (ultra-high I/O disk type).

properties.name: disk_type
properties.description: • disk_type - (Required) Whether the disk is a system disk or a data disk. Option DATA indicates a data disk. option SYS indicates a system disk.
The personality block supports:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.

properties.name: contents
properties.description: • contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
The public_ip block supports:

properties.name: eip
properties.description: (Required) The configuration parameter for creating an elastic IP address that will be automatically assigned to the instance. The eip structure is described below.
The eip block supports:

properties.name: ip_type
properties.description: • ip_type - (Required) The IP address type. The system only supports 5_bgp (indicates dynamic BGP).

properties.name: bandwidth
properties.description: • bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth information. The structure is described below.
The bandwidth block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The bandwidth (Mbit/s). The value range is 1 to 300.

properties.name: share_type
properties.description: • share_type - (Required) The bandwidth sharing type. The system only supports PER (indicates exclusive bandwidth).

properties.name: charging_mode
properties.description: • charging_mode - (Required) The bandwidth charging mode. The system only supports traffic.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS group. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new AS group.

properties.name: scaling_group_name
properties.description: • scaling_group_name - (Required) The name of the scaling group. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: scaling_configuration_id
properties.description: • scaling_configuration_id - (Optional) The configuration ID which defines configurations of instances in the AS group.

properties.name: desire_instance_number
properties.description: • desire_instance_number - (Optional) The expected number of instances. The default value is the minimum number of instances. The value ranges from the minimum number of instances to the maximum number of instances.

properties.name: min_instance_number
properties.description: • min_instance_number - (Optional) The minimum number of instances. The default value is 0.

properties.name: max_instance_number
properties.description: • max_instance_number - (Optional) The maximum number of instances. The default value is 0.

properties.name: cool_down_time
properties.description: • cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds). The value ranges from 0 to 86400, and is 900 by default.

properties.name: lb_listener_id
properties.description: • lb_listener_id - (Optional) The ELB listener IDs. The system supports up to three ELB listeners, the IDs of which are separated using a comma (,).

properties.name: available_zones
properties.description: • available_zones - (Optional) The availability zones in which to create the instances in the autoscaling group.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: • networks - (Required) An array of one or more network IDs. The system supports up to five networks. The networks object structure is documented below.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: • security_groups - (Required) An array of one or more security group IDs to associate with the group. The security_groups object structure is documented below.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) The VPC ID. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: health_periodic_audit_method
properties.description: • health_periodic_audit_method - (Optional) The health check method for instances in the AS group. The health check methods include ELB_AUDIT and NOVA_AUDIT. If load balancing is configured, the default value of this parameter is ELB_AUDIT. Otherwise, the default value is NOVA_AUDIT.

properties.name: health_periodic_audit_time
properties.description: • health_periodic_audit_time - (Optional) The health check period for instances. The period has four options: 5 minutes (default), 15 minutes, 60 minutes, and 180 minutes.

properties.name: instance_terminate_policy
properties.description: • instance_terminate_policy - (Optional) The instance removal policy. The policy has four options: OLD_CONFIG_OLD_INSTANCE (default), OLD_CONFIG_NEW_INSTANCE, OLD_INSTANCE, and NEW_INSTANCE.

properties.name: notifications
properties.description: • notifications - (Optional) The notification mode. The system only supports EMAIL mode which refers to notification by email.

properties.name: delete_publicip
properties.description: • delete_publicip - (Optional) Whether to delete the elastic IP address bound to the instances of AS group when deleting the instances. The options are true and false.

properties.name: delete_instances
properties.description: • delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group when deleting the AS group. The options are yes and no.
The networks block supports:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The network UUID.
The security_groups block supports:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The UUID of the security group.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS policy. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new AS policy.

properties.name: scaling_policy_name
properties.description: • scaling_policy_name - (Required) The name of the AS policy. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: scaling_group_id
properties.description: • scaling_group_id - (Required) The AS group ID. Changing this creates a new AS policy.

properties.name: scaling_policy_type
properties.description: • scaling_policy_type - (Required) The AS policy type. The values can be ALARM, SCHEDULED, and RECURRENCE.

properties.name: alarm_id
properties.description: • alarm_id - (Optional) The alarm rule ID. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to ALARM.

properties.name: scheduled_policy
properties.description: • scheduled_policy - (Optional) The periodic or scheduled AS policy. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to SCHEDULED or RECURRENCE. The scheduled_policy structure is documented below.

properties.name: scaling_policy_action
properties.description: • scaling_policy_action - (Optional) The action of the AS policy. The scaling_policy_action structure is documented below.

properties.name: cool_down_time
properties.description: • cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds), and is 900 by default.
The scheduled_policy block supports:

properties.name: launch_time
properties.description: • launch_time - (Required) The time when the scaling action is triggered. If scaling_policy_type is set to SCHEDULED, the time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ. If scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE, the time format is hh:mm.

properties.name: recurrence_type
properties.description: • recurrence_type - (Optional) The periodic triggering type. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE. The options include Daily, Weekly, and Monthly.

properties.name: recurrence_value
properties.description: • recurrence_value - (Optional) The frequency at which scaling actions are triggered.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: • start_time - (Optional) The start time of the scaling action triggered periodically. The time format complies with UTC. The current time is used by default. The time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: • end_time - (Optional) The end time of the scaling action triggered periodically. The time format complies with UTC. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE. The time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.
The scaling_policy_action block supports:

properties.name: operation
properties.description: • operation - (Optional) The operation to be performed. The options include ADD (default), REMOVE, and SET.

properties.name: instance_number
properties.description: • instance_number - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the volume. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes).

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone for the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: consistency_group_id
properties.description: • consistency_group_id - (Optional) The consistency group to place the volume in.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the volume. Changing this updates the volume's description.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The image ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to associate with the volume. Changing this updates the existing volume metadata.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the volume. Changing this updates the volume's name.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: source_replica
properties.description: • source_replica - (Optional) The volume ID to replicate with.

properties.name: source_vol_id
properties.description: • source_vol_id - (Optional) The volume ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Optional) The type of volume to create. Available types are SSD, SAS and SATA. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: cascade
properties.description: • cascade - (Optional, Default:false) Specifies to delete all snapshots associated with the EVS disk.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Cluster name. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Cluster tag, key/value pair format. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: annotations
properties.description: • annotations - (Optional) Cluster annotation, key/value pair format. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: flavor_id - (Required) Cluster specifications. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource. Possible values:

properties.name: cce.s1.small
properties.description: small-scale single cluster (up to 50 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s1.medium
properties.description: medium-scale single cluster (up to 200 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s1.large
properties.description: large-scale single cluster (up to 1000 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s2.small
properties.description: small-scale HA cluster (up to 50 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s2.medium
properties.description: medium-scale HA cluster (up to 200 nodes).

properties.name: cce.s2.large
properties.description: large-scale HA cluster (up to 1000 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t1.small
properties.description: small-scale single physical machine cluster (up to 10 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t1.medium
properties.description: medium-scale single physical machine cluster (up to 100 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t1.large
properties.description: large-scale single physical machine cluster (up to 500 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t2.small
properties.description: small-scale HA physical machine cluster (up to 10 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t2.medium
properties.description: medium-scale HA physical machine cluster (up to 100 nodes).

properties.name: cce.t2.large
properties.description: large-scale HA physical machine cluster (up to 500 nodes).

properties.name: cluster_version
properties.description: • cluster_version - (Optional) For the cluster version, possible values are v1.7.3-r10 or v1.9.2-r1.

properties.name: cluster_type
properties.description: • cluster_type - (Required) Cluster Type, possible values are VirtualMachine and BareMetal. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Cluster description.

properties.name: billing_mode
properties.description: • billing_mode - (Optional) Charging mode of the cluster, which is 0 (on demand). Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: extend_param
properties.description: • extend_param - (Optional) Extended parameter. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) The ID of the VPC used to create the node. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the subnet used to create the node. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: highway_subnet_id
properties.description: • highway_subnet_id - (Optional) The ID of the high speed network used to create bare metal nodes. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: container_network_type - (Required) Container network parameters. Possible values:

properties.name: overlay_l2
properties.description: An overlay_l2 network built for containers by using Open vSwitch(OVS)

properties.name: underlay_ipvlan
properties.description: An underlay_ipvlan network built for bare metal servers by using ipvlan.

properties.name: vpc-router
properties.description: An vpc-router network built for containers by using ipvlan and custom VPC routes.

properties.name: container_network_cidr
properties.description: • container_network_cidr - (Optional) Container network segment. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: authentication_mode
properties.description: • authentication_mode - (Optional) Authentication mode of the cluster, possible values are x509 and rbac. Defaults to x509. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: multi_az
properties.description: • multi_az - (Optional) Enable multiple AZs for the cluster, only when using HA flavors. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cluster_id
properties.description: • cluster_id - (Required) ID of the cluster. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: billing_mode
properties.description: • billing_mode - (Optional) Node's billing mode: The value is 0 (on demand). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Node Name.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: • labels - (Optional) Node tag, key/value pair format. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: annotations
properties.description: • annotations - (Optional) Node annotation, key/value pair format. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: flavor_id
properties.description: • flavor_id - (Required) Specifies the flavor id. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Required) specify the name of the available partition (AZ). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: os
properties.description: • os - (Optional) Operating System of the node, possible values are EulerOS 2.2 and CentOS 7.1. Defaults to EulerOS 2.2. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: key_pair
properties.description: • key_pair - (Optional) Key pair name when logging in to select the key pair mode. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) root password when logging in to select the password mode. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: eip_ids
properties.description: • eip_ids - (Optional) List of existing elastic IP IDs. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
Note: If the eip_ids parameter is configured, you do not need to configure the eip_count and bandwidth parameters: iptype, charge_mode, bandwidth_size and share_type.

properties.name: eip_count
properties.description: • eip_count - (Optional) Number of elastic IPs to be dynamically created. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: iptype
properties.description: • iptype - (Optional) Elastic IP type. Default is 5_bgp. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: bandwidth_charge_mode
properties.description: • bandwidth_charge_mode - (Optional) Bandwidth billing type. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: sharetype
properties.description: • sharetype - (Optional) Bandwidth sharing type. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: bandwidth_size
properties.description: • bandwidth_size - (Optional) Bandwidth size. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: extend_param_charging_mode
properties.description: • extend_param_charging_mode - (Optional) Node charging mode, 0 is on-demand charging. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: ecs_performance_type
properties.description: • ecs_performance_type - (Optional) Classification of cloud server specifications. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: order_id
properties.description: • order_id - (Optional) Order ID, mandatory when the node payment type is the automatic payment package period type. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: product_id
properties.description: • product_id - (Optional) The Product ID. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: max_pods
properties.description: • max_pods - (Optional) The maximum number of instances a node is allowed to create. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: • public_key - (Optional) The Public key. Changing this parameter will create a new cluster resource.
root_volume - (Required) It corresponds to the system disk related configuration. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Disk size in GB.

properties.name: volumetype
properties.description: • volumetype - (Required) Disk type.

properties.name: extend_param
properties.description: • extend_param - (Optional) Disk expansion parameters.
data_volumes - (Required) Represents the data disk to be created. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Disk size in GB.

properties.name: volumetype
properties.description: • volumetype - (Required) Disk type.

properties.name: extend_param
properties.description: • extend_param - (Optional) Disk expansion parameters.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Required) Available zone. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: flavor_id
properties.description: • flavor_id - (Required) Flavor id. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Cluster name. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) Security group ID. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Subnet ID. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Required) Cluster version. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) VPC ID. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
<hr/>

properties.name: email
properties.description: • email - (Optional) Notification email addresses. The max number is 5. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: enterprise_project_id
properties.description: • enterprise_project_id - (Optional) The enterprise project id. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: is_auto_off
properties.description: • is_auto_off - (Optional) Whether to automatically shut down. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: phone_num
properties.description: • phone_num - (Optional) Notification phone numbers. The max number is 5. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: schedule_boot_time
properties.description: • schedule_boot_time - (Optional) Timed boot time. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: schedule_off_time
properties.description: • schedule_off_time - (Optional) Timed shutdown time. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID.

properties.name: bandwidth
properties.description: • bandwidth - (Optional) Specifies the bandwidth (Mbit/s). This parameter is mandatory when type is set to External, and it is invalid when type is set to Internal. The value ranges from 1 to 300.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Specifies the load balancer type. The value can be Internal or External.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Required) Specifies the status of the load balancer. Value range: 0 or false: indicates that the load balancer is stopped. Only tenants are allowed to enter these two values. 1 or true: indicates that the load balancer is running properly. 2 or false: indicates that the load balancer is frozen. Only tenants are allowed to enter these two values.

properties.name: vip_subnet_id
properties.description: • vip_subnet_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the private network to be added. This parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal, and it is invalid when type is set to External.

properties.name: az
properties.description: • az - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the availability zone (AZ). This parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal, and it is invalid when type is set to External.

properties.name: charge_mode
properties.description: • charge_mode - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic IP addresses. The value is traffic.

properties.name: eip_type
properties.description: • eip_type - (Optional) This parameter is reserved.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Optional) Specifies the security group ID. The value is a string of 1 to 200 characters that consists of uppercase and lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-). This parameter is mandatory only when type is set to Internal.

properties.name: vip_address
properties.description: • vip_address - (Optional) Specifies the IP address provided by ELB. When typeis set to External, the value of this parameter is the elastic IP address. When type is set to Internal, the value of this parameter is the private network IP address. You can select an existing elastic IP address and create a public network load balancer. When this parameter is configured, parameters bandwidth, charge_mode, and eip_type are invalid.

properties.name: tenantid
properties.description: • tenantid - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory only when type is set to Internal.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: • loadbalancer_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the load balancer to which the listener belongs.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Specifies the listening protocol used for layer 4 or 7. The value can be HTTP, TCP, HTTPS, or UDP.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) Specifies the listening port. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: backend_protocol
properties.description: • backend_protocol - (Required) Specifies the backend protocol. If the value of protocol is UDP, the value of this parameter can only be UDP. The value can be HTTP, TCP, or UDP.

properties.name: backend_port
properties.description: • backend_port - (Required) Specifies the backend port. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: lb_algorithm
properties.description: • lb_algorithm - (Required) Specifies the load balancing algorithm for the listener. The value can be roundrobin, leastconn, or source.

properties.name: session_sticky
properties.description: • session_sticky - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable sticky session. The value can be true or false. The Sticky session is enabled when the value is true, and is disabled when the value is false. If the value of protocol is HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP, and the value of lb_algorithm is not roundrobin, the value of this parameter can only be false.

properties.name: sticky_session_type
properties.description: • sticky_session_type - (Optional) Specifies the cookie processing method. The value is insert. insert indicates that the cookie is inserted by the load balancer. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, and session_sticky to true. The default value is insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is set to TCP or UDP, which means the parameter is empty.

properties.name: cookie_timeout
properties.description: • cookie_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the cookie timeout period (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, session_sticky to true, and sticky_session_type to insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is set to TCP or UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.

properties.name: tcp_timeout
properties.description: • tcp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the TCP timeout period (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value ranges from 1 to 5.

properties.name: tcp_draining
properties.description: • tcp_draining - (Optional) Specifies whether to maintain the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value can be true or false.

properties.name: tcp_draining_timeout
properties.description: • tcp_draining_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the timeout duration (minutes) for the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP, and tcp_draining to true. The value ranges from 0 to 60.

properties.name: certificate_id
properties.description: • certificate_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the SSL certificate used for security authentication when HTTPS is used to make API calls. This parameter is mandatory if the value of protocol is HTTPS. The value can be obtained by viewing the details of the SSL certificate.

properties.name: udp_timeout
properties.description: • udp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the UDP timeout duration (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.

properties.name: ssl_protocols
properties.description: • ssl_protocols - (Optional) Specifies the SSL protocol standard supported by a tracker, which is used for enabling specified encryption protocols. This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value is TLSv1.2 or TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1. The default value is TLSv1.2.

properties.name: ssl_ciphers
properties.description: • ssl_ciphers - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol. This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: listener_id
properties.description: • listener_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the listener to which the health check task belongs.

properties.name: healthcheck_protocol
properties.description: • healthcheck_protocol - (Optional) Specifies the protocol used for the health check. The value can be HTTP or TCP (case-insensitive).

properties.name: healthcheck_uri
properties.description: • healthcheck_uri - (Optional) Specifies the URI for health check. This parameter is valid when healthcheck_ protocol is HTTP. The value is a string of 1 to 80 characters that must start with a slash (/) and can only contain letters, digits, and special characters, such as -/.%?#&.

properties.name: healthcheck_connect_port
properties.description: • healthcheck_connect_port - (Optional) Specifies the port used for the health check. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: healthy_threshold
properties.description: • healthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health check result is success, that is, the number of consecutive successful health checks when the health check result of the backend server changes from fail to success. The value ranges from 1 to 10.

properties.name: unhealthy_threshold
properties.description: • unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health check result is fail, that is, the number of consecutive failed health checks when the health check result of the backend server changes from success to fail. The value ranges from 1 to 10.

properties.name: healthcheck_timeout
properties.description: • healthcheck_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the maximum timeout duration (s) for the health check. The value ranges from 1 to 50.

properties.name: healthcheck_interval
properties.description: • healthcheck_interval - (Optional) Specifies the maximum interval (s) for health check. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: listener_id
properties.description: • listener_id - (Required) Specifies the listener ID.

properties.name: server_id
properties.description: • server_id - (Required) Specifies the backend member ID.

properties.name: private_address
properties.description: • private_address - (Required) Specifies the private IP address of the backend member.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: alarm_name
properties.description: • alarm_name - (Required) Specifies the name of an alarm rule. The value can be a string of 1 to 128 characters that can consist of numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

properties.name: alarm_description
properties.description: • alarm_description - (Optional) The value can be a string of 0 to 256 characters.

properties.name: metric
properties.description: • metric - (Required) Specifies the alarm metrics. The structure is described below.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: • condition - (Required) Specifies the alarm triggering condition. The structure is described below.

properties.name: alarm_actions
properties.description: • alarm_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by an alarm. The structure is described below.

properties.name: insufficientdata_actions
properties.description: • insufficientdata_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by data insufficiency. The structure is described below.

properties.name: ok_actions
properties.description: • ok_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by the clearing of an alarm. The structure is described below.

properties.name: alarm_enabled
properties.description: • alarm_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the alarm. The default value is true.

properties.name: alarm_action_enabled
properties.description: • alarm_action_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the action to be triggered by an alarm. The default value is true. Note: If alarm_action_enabled is set to true, at least one of the following parameters alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions cannot be empty. If alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions coexist, their corresponding notification_list must be of the same value.
The metric block supports:

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: • namespace - (Required) Specifies the namespace in service.item format. service.item can be a string of 3 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: • metric_name - (Required) Specifies the metric name. The value can be a string of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description: • dimensions - (Required) Specifies the list of metric dimensions. Currently, the maximum length of the dimesion list that are supported is 3. The structure is described below.
The dimensions block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the dimension name. The value can be a string of 1 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the dimension value. The value can be a string of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter or a number and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
The condition block supports:

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Required) Specifies the alarm checking period in seconds. The value can be 1, 300, 1200, 3600, 14400, and 86400. Note: If period is set to 1, the raw metric data is used to determine whether to generate an alarm.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter - (Required) Specifies the data rollup methods. The value can be max, min, average, sum, and vaiance.

properties.name: comparison_operator
properties.description: • comparison_operator - (Required) Specifies the comparison condition of alarm thresholds. The value can be >, =, <, >=, or <=.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the alarm threshold. The value ranges from 0 to Number of 1.7976931348623157e+308.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: • unit - (Optional) Specifies the data unit.

properties.name: count
properties.description: • count - (Required) Specifies the number of consecutive occurrence times. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
the alarm_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value can be notification or autoscaling. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user. autoscaling: indicates that a scaling action will be triggered.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Optional) specifies the topic urn list of the target notification objects. the maximum length is 5. the topic urn list can be obtained from simple message notification (smn) and in the following format: urn: smn:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|-){1,32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]){32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|-|_){1,256}. if type is set to notification, the value of notification_list cannot be empty. if type is set to autoscaling, the value of notification_list must be [] and the value of namespace must be sys.as. Note: to enable the as alarm rules take effect, you must bind scaling policies. for details, see the auto scaling api reference.
the insufficientdata_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value is notification. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
the ok_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value is notification. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.

properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.

properties.description: • image_name - (Optional; Required if image_id is empty and not booting from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The name of the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.description: • flavor_id - (Optional; Required if flavor_name is empty) The flavor ID of the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

Changing this results in adding/removing security groups from the existing server. Note: When attaching the instance to networks using Ports, place the security groups on the Port and not the instance.

properties.description: • availability_zone - (Required) The availability zone in which to create the server. Please refer to https://developer.huaweicloud.com/endpoint for the values. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.description: • network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the instance. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: key_pair
properties.description: • key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: block_device
properties.description: • block_device - (Optional) Configuration of block devices. The block_device structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server. You can specify multiple block devices which will create an instance with multiple disks. This configuration is very flexible, so please see the following reference for more information.

properties.name: scheduler_hints

properties.name: stop_before_destroy
properties.description: • stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly. If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.

properties.name: volume_size
properties.description: • volume_size - The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume, source=blank and destination=local, and source=blank and destination=volume. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.description: • boot_index - (Optional) The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.description: • destination_type - (Optional) The type that gets created. Possible values are "volume" and "local". Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: same_host

The rule block supports:

properties.name: from_port
properties.description: • from_port - (Required) An integer representing the lower bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: to_port
properties.description: • to_port - (Required) An integer representing the upper bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.description: • ip_protocol - (Required) The protocol type that will be allowed. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.description: • cidr - (Optional) Required if from_group_id or self is empty. The IP range that will be the source of network traffic to the security group. Use 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IP addresses. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with from_group_id or self.

properties.name: from_group_id
properties.description: • from_group_id - (Optional) Required if cidr or self is empty. The ID of a group from which to forward traffic to the parent group. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or self.

properties.name: self
properties.description: • self - (Optional) Required if cidr and from_group_id is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or from_group_id.

properties.description: : high I/O(performance-optimized) disk type.

properties.name: uh-l1
properties.description: : ultra-high I/O(latency-optimized) disk type.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The size of the data disk in GB. The value range is 10 to 32768. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) Specifies the snapshot ID or ID of the original data disk contained in the full-ECS image. Changing this creates a new server.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: engine_version
properties.description: • engine_version - (Required) Engine version. Versions 5.5.1 and 6.2.3 are supported. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Cluster name. It contains 4 to 32 characters. Only letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (_) are allowed. The value must start with a letter. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: node_config
properties.description: • node_config - (Required) Node configuration. Structure is documented below. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The node_config block supports:

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) Availability zone (AZ). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Required) Instance flavor name. Value range of flavor ess.spec-1u8g: 40 GB to 640 GB Value range of flavor ess.spec-2u16g: 40 GB to 1280 GB Value range of flavor ess.spec-4u32g: 40 GB to 2560 GB Value range of flavor ess.spec-8u64g: 80 GB to 5120 GB Value range of flavor ess.spec-16u128g: 160 GB to 10240 GB. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: network_info
properties.description: • network_info - (Required) Network information. Structure is documented below. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: • volume - (Required) Information about the volume. Structure is documented below. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The network_info block supports:

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) Security group ID. All instances in a cluster must have the same subnets and security groups. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Subnet ID. All instances in a cluster must have the same subnets and security groups. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) VPC ID, which is used for configuring cluster network. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The volume block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) Volume size, which must be a multiple of 4 and 10. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Required) COMMON: Common I/O. The SATA disk is used. HIGH: High I/O. The SAS disk is used. ULTRAHIGH: Ultra-high I/O. The solid-state drive (SSD) is used. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
<hr/>

properties.name: engine_type
properties.description: • engine_type - (Optional) Engine type. The default value is elasticsearch. Currently, the value can only be elasticsearch. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: expect_node_num
properties.description: • expect_node_num - (Optional) Number of cluster instances. The value range is 1 to 32.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backup_name
properties.description: • backup_name - (Optional) Name for the backup. The value consists of 1 to 255 characters and can contain only letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). Changing backup_name creates a new backup.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Backup description. The value consists of 0 to 255 characters and must not contain a greater-than sign (>) or less-than sign (<). Changing description creates a new backup.

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: • resource_id - (Required) ID of the target to which the backup is restored. Changing this creates a new backup.

properties.name: resource_type
properties.description: • resource_type - (Optional) Type of the target to which the backup is restored. The default value is OS::Nova::Server for an ECS. Changing this creates a new backup.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of backup policy. The value consists of 1 to 255 characters and can contain only letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Backup policy description. The value consists of 0 to 255 characters and must not contain a greater-than sign (>) or less-than sign (<).

properties.name: provider_id
properties.description: • provider_id - (Required) Specifies backup provider ID. Default value is fc4d5750-22e7-4798-8a46-f48f62c4c1da

properties.name: common
properties.description: • common - (Optional) General backup policy parameters, which are blank by default.

properties.description: scheduled_operation block supports the following arguments:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies Scheduling period name.The value consists of 1 to 255 characters and can contain only letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies Scheduling period description.The value consists of 0 to 255 characters and must not contain a greater-than sign (>) or less-than sign (<).

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the scheduling period is enabled. Default value is true

properties.name: max_backups
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies maximum number of backups that can be automatically created for a backup object.

properties.name: retention_duration_days
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies duration of retaining a backup, in days.

properties.name: permanent
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether backups are permanently retained.

properties.name: trigger_pattern
properties.description: (Required) Specifies Scheduling policy of the scheduler.

properties.name: operation_type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies Operation type, which can be backup.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: resource block supports the following arguments:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the ID of the object to be backed up.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Entity object type of the backup object. If the type is VMs, the value is OS::Nova::Server.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Specifies backup object name.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket_name
properties.description: • bucket_name - (Required) The OBS bucket name for a tracker.

properties.name: file_prefix_name
properties.description: • file_prefix_name - (Optional) The prefix of a log that needs to be stored in an OBS bucket.

properties.name: is_support_smn
properties.description: • is_support_smn - (Required) Specifies whether SMN is supported. When the value is false, topic_id and operations can be left empty.

properties.name: topic_id
properties.description: • topic_id - (Required)The theme of the SMN service, Is obtained from SMN and in the format of urn:smn:([a-z]|[A-Z]|[0-9]|-){1,32}:([a-z]|[A-Z]|[0-9]){32}:([a-z]|[A-Z]|[0-9]|-|_){1,256}.

properties.name: operations
properties.description: • operations - (Required) Trigger conditions for sending a notification.

properties.name: is_send_all_key_operation
properties.description: • is_send_all_key_operation - (Required) When the value is false, operations cannot be left empty.

properties.name: need_notify_user_list
properties.description: • need_notify_user_list - (Optional) The users using the login function. When these users log in, notifications will be sent.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cu_count
properties.description: • cu_count - (Required) Minimum number of CUs that are bound to a queue. The value can be 4, 16, or 64. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of a queue. The name can contain only digits, letters, and underscores (), but cannot contain only digits or start with an underscore (). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of a queue. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: management_subnet_cidr
properties.description: • management_subnet_cidr - (Optional) CIDR of the management subnet. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: subnet_cidr
properties.description: • subnet_cidr - (Optional) Subnet CIDR. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: vpc_cidr
properties.description: • vpc_cidr - (Optional) VPC CIDR. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Indicates the name of an instance. An instance name starts with a letter, consists of 4 to 64 characters, and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Indicates the description of an instance. It is a character string containing not more than 1024 characters.

properties.name: engine
properties.description: • engine - (Optional) Indicates a message engine. Options: rabbitmq and kafka. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: engine_version
properties.description: • engine_version - (Optional) Indicates the version of a message engine. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Required) Indicates the Cache capacity. Unit: GB. For a DCS Redis or Memcached instance in single-node or master/standby mode, the cache capacity can be 2 GB, 4 GB, 8 GB, 16 GB, 32 GB, or 64 GB. For a DCS Redis instance in cluster mode, the cache capacity can be 64, 128, 256, 512, or 1024 GB. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: partition_num
properties.description: • partition_num - (Optional) This parameter is mandatory when a Kafka instance is created. Indicates the maximum number of topics in a Kafka instance. When specification is 300 MB: 900 When specification is 600 MB: 1800 When specification is 1200 MB: 1800

properties.name: access_user
properties.description: • access_user - (Optional) Username used for accessing a DCS instance after password authentication. A username starts with a letter, consists of 1 to 64 characters, and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-). Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) Password of a DCS instance. The password of a DCS Redis instance must meet the following complexity requirements: Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) Tenant's VPC ID. For details on how to create VPCs, see the Virtual Private Cloud API Reference. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) Tenant's security group ID. For details on how to create security groups, see the Virtual Private Cloud API Reference.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Subnet ID. For details on how to create subnets, see the Virtual Private Cloud API Reference. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: available_zones
properties.description: • available_zones - (Required) IDs of the AZs where cache nodes reside. For details on how to query AZs, see Querying AZ Information. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: product_id
properties.description: • product_id - (Required) Product ID used to differentiate DCS instance types. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: maintain_begin
properties.description: • maintain_begin - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window starts. Format: HH:mm:ss. The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows. The start time must be set to 22:00, 02:00, 06:00, 10:00, 14:00, or 18:00. Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_begin is left blank, parameter maintain_end is also blank. In this case, the system automatically allocates the default start time 02:00.

properties.name: maintain_end
properties.description: • maintain_end - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window ends. Format: HH:mm:ss. The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows. The end time is four hours later than the start time. For example, if the start time is 22:00, the end time is 02:00. Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_end is left blank, parameter maintain_begin is also blank. In this case, the system automatically allocates the default end time 06:00.

properties.name: save_days
properties.description: • save_days - (Optional) Retention time. Unit: day. Range: 1–7. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: backup_type
properties.description: • backup_type - (Optional) Backup type. Options: auto: automatic backup. manual: manual backup. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: begin_at
properties.description: • begin_at - (Optional) Time at which backup starts. "00:00-01:00" indicates that backup starts at 00:00:00. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: period_type
properties.description: • period_type - (Optional) Interval at which backup is performed. Currently, only weekly backup is supported. Changing this creates a new instance.

properties.name: backup_at
properties.description: • backup_at - (Optional) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1 indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday. Changing this creates a new instance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: partition_count
properties.description: • partition_count - (Required) Number of the expect partitions. NOTE: Each stream can be scaled up and down a total of five times within one hour. After the stream is successfully scaled up or down, it cannot be scaled up or down again within the next one hour.

properties.name: stream_name
properties.description: • stream_name - (Required) Name of the DIS stream to be created.
<hr/>

properties.name: auto_scale_max_partition_count
properties.description: • auto_scale_max_partition_count - (Optional) Maximum number of partition for automatic scaling. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: auto_scale_min_partition_count
properties.description: • auto_scale_min_partition_count - (Optional) Minimum number of partition for automatic scaling. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: compression_format
properties.description: • compression_format - (Optional) Data compression type. The value is one of snappy, gzip and zip. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: csv_delimiter
properties.description: • csv_delimiter - (Optional) Field separator for CSV file. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: data_schema
properties.description: • data_schema - (Optional) User's JOSN, CSV format data schema, described with Avro schema. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: • data_type - (Optional) Data type of the data putting into the stream. The value is one of BLOB, JSON and CSV. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: retention_period
properties.description: • retention_period - (Optional) The number of hours for which data from the stream will be retained in DIS. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: stream_type
properties.description: • stream_type - (Optional) Stream Type. The value is COMMON(means 1M bandwidth) or ADVANCED(means 5M bandwidth). Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags for the newly created DIS stream. Structure is documented below. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The tags block supports:

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Optional) The key of tag. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Optional) The value of tag. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Indicates the unique name of a group. A string of 1 to 64 characters that contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, hyphens (-), and underscores (_). The name cannot be modified once specified.

properties.name: queue_id
properties.description: • queue_id - (Required) Indicates the ID of a specified queue.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Indicates the name of an instance. An instance name starts with a letter, consists of 4 to 64 characters, and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Indicates the description of an instance. It is a character string containing not more than 1024 characters.

properties.name: engine
properties.description: • engine - (Optional) Indicates a message engine. Options: rabbitmq and kafka.

properties.name: engine_version
properties.description: • engine_version - (Optional) Indicates the version of a message engine.

properties.name: specification
properties.description: • specification - (Optional) This parameter is mandatory if the engine is kafka. Indicates the baseline bandwidth of a Kafka instance, that is, the maximum amount of data transferred per unit time. Unit: byte/s. Options: 300 MB, 600 MB, 1200 MB.

properties.name: storage_space
properties.description: • storage_space - (Required) Indicates the message storage space. Value range: Single-node RabbitMQ instance: 100–90000 GB Cluster RabbitMQ instance: 100 GB x Number of nodes to 90000 GB, 200 GB x Number of nodes to 90000 GB, 300 GB x Number of nodes to 90000 GB Kafka instance with specification being 300 MB: 1200–90000 GB Kafka instance with specification being 600 MB: 2400–90000 GB Kafka instance with specification being 1200 MB: 4800–90000 GB

properties.name: partition_num
properties.description: • partition_num - (Optional) This parameter is mandatory when a Kafka instance is created. Indicates the maximum number of topics in a Kafka instance. When specification is 300 MB: 900 When specification is 600 MB: 1800 When specification is 1200 MB: 1800

properties.name: access_user
properties.description: • access_user - (Optional) Indicates a username. If the engine is rabbitmq, this parameter is mandatory. If the engine is kafka, this parameter is optional. A username consists of 4 to 64 characters and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-).

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) If the engine is rabbitmq, this parameter is mandatory. If the engine is kafka, this parameter is mandatory when ssl_enable is true and is invalid when ssl_enable is false. Indicates the password of an instance. An instance password must meet the following complexity requirements: Must be 8 to 32 characters long. Must contain at least 2 of the following character types: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits, and special characters (`~!@#$%&*()-_=+|[{}]:'",<.>/?).

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) Indicates the ID of a VPC.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) Indicates the ID of a security group.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Indicates the ID of a subnet.

properties.name: available_zones
properties.description: • available_zones - (Required) Indicates the ID of an AZ. The parameter value can not be left blank or an empty array. For details, see section Querying AZ Information.

properties.name: product_id
properties.description: • product_id - (Required) Indicates a product ID.

properties.name: maintain_begin
properties.description: • maintain_begin - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window starts. Format: HH:mm:ss. The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows. The start time must be set to 22:00, 02:00, 06:00, 10:00, 14:00, or 18:00. Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_begin is left blank, parameter maintain_end is also blank. In this case, the system automatically allocates the default start time 02:00.

properties.name: maintain_end
properties.description: • maintain_end - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window ends. Format: HH:mm:ss. The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows. The end time is four hours later than the start time. For example, if the start time is 22:00, the end time is 02:00. Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_end is left blank, parameter maintain_begin is also blank. In this case, the system automatically allocates the default end time 06:00.

properties.name: enable_publicip
properties.description: • enable_publicip - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable public access to a RabbitMQ instance. true: enable, false: disable

properties.name: publicip_id
properties.description: • publicip_id - (Optional) Indicates the ID of the elastic IP address (EIP) bound to a RabbitMQ instance. This parameter is mandatory if public access is enabled (that is, enable_publicip is set to true).

properties.name: storage_spec_code
properties.description: • storage_spec_code - (Optional) Indicates the storage I/O specification. For details on how to select a disk type, see Disk Types and Disk Performance. Options for a RabbitMQ instance: dms.physical.storage.normal dms.physical.storage.high dms.physical.storage.ultra Options for a Kafka instance: When specification is 300 MB: dms.physical.storage.high or dms.physical.storage.ultra When specification is 600 MB: dms.physical.storage.ultra When specification is 1200 MB: dms.physical.storage.ultra
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Indicates the unique name of a queue. A string of 1 to 64 characters that contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, hyphens (-), and underscores (_). The name cannot be modified once specified.

properties.name: queue_mode
properties.description: • queue_mode - (Optional) Indicates the queue type. It only support 'NORMAL' and 'FIFO'. NORMAL: Standard queue. Best-effort ordering. Messages might be retrieved in an order different from which they were sent. Select standard queues when throughput is important. FIFO: First-ln-First-out (FIFO) queue. FIFO delivery. Messages are retrieved in the order they were sent. Select FIFO queues when the order of messages is important. Default value: NORMAL.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Indicates the basic information about a queue. The queue description must be 0 to 160 characters in length, and does not contain angle brackets (<) and (>).

properties.name: redrive_policy
properties.description: • redrive_policy - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable dead letter messages. Dead letter messages indicate messages that cannot be normally consumed. The redrive_policy should be set to 'enable' or 'disable'. The default value is 'disable'.

properties.name: max_consume_count
properties.description: • max_consume_count - (Optional) This parameter is mandatory only when redrive_policy is set to enable. This parameter indicates the maximum number of allowed message consumption failures. When a message fails to be consumed after the number of consumption attempts of this message reaches this value, DMS stores this message into the dead letter queue. The max_consume_count value range is 1–100.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the record set. Note the . at the end of the name. Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The type of record set. The options include A, AAAA, MX, CNAME, TXT, NS, SRV, and PTR. Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.description: • ttl - (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the record set (in seconds). The value range is 300–2147483647. The default value is 300.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the record set.

properties.name: records
properties.description: • records - (Required) An array of DNS records.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options. Changing this creates a new record set.

If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new DNS zone. Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the zone. Note the . at the end of the name. Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

properties.name: email
properties.description: • email - (Optional) The email contact for the zone record.

properties.name: zone_type
properties.description: • zone_type - (Optional) The type of zone. Can either be public or private. Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

properties.name: router
properties.description: • router - (Optional) Router configuration block which is required if zone_type is private. The router structure is documented below.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the zone.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the zone.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options. Changing this creates a new DNS zone.
The router block supports:

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) The router UUID.

properties.name: router_region
properties.description: • router_region - (Required) The region of the router.

• name - (Required) Cluster name, which must be unique and contains 4 to 64
    characters, which consist of letters, digits, hyphens (-), or underscores (_) only and must start with a letter.
