properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Human-readable name for the Loadbalancer. Does not have to be unique.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the Loadbalancer.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns the Loadbalancer. Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID other than their own. Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.

properties.name: vip_address
properties.description: • vip_address - (Optional) The ip address of the load balancer. Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the Loadbalancer. A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Optional) The UUID of a flavor. Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.

properties.name: loadbalancer_provider
properties.description: • loadbalancer_provider - (Optional) The name of the provider. Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.

properties.name: security_group_ids
properties.description: • security_group_ids - (Optional) A list of security group IDs to apply to the loadbalancer. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new Listener.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The protocol - can either be TCP, HTTP, HTTPS or TERMINATED_HTTPS. Changing this creates a new Listener.

properties.name: protocol_port
properties.description: • protocol_port - (Required) The port on which to listen for client traffic. Changing this creates a new Listener.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns the Listener. Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID other than their own. Changing this creates a new Listener.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: • loadbalancer_id - (Required) The load balancer on which to provision this Listener. Changing this creates a new Listener.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Human-readable name for the Listener. Does not have to be unique.

properties.name: default_pool_id
properties.description: • default_pool_id - (Optional) The ID of the default pool with which the Listener is associated. Changing this creates a new Listener.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the Listener.

properties.name: connection_limit
properties.description: • connection_limit - (Optional) The maximum number of connections allowed for the Listener.

properties.name: default_tls_container_ref
properties.description: • default_tls_container_ref - (Optional) A reference to a Barbican Secrets container which stores TLS information. This is required if the protocol is TERMINATED_HTTPS. See here for more information.

properties.name: sni_container_refs
properties.description: • sni_container_refs - (Optional) A list of references to Barbican Secrets containers which store SNI information. See here for more information.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the Listener. A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new pool.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns the pool. Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID other than their own. Changing this creates a new pool.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Human-readable name for the pool.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the pool.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol = (Required) The protocol - can either be TCP, HTTP or HTTPS. Changing this creates a new pool.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: • loadbalancer_id - (Optional) The load balancer on which to provision this pool. Changing this creates a new pool. Note: One of LoadbalancerID or ListenerID must be provided.

properties.name: listener_id
properties.description: • listener_id - (Optional) The Listener on which the members of the pool will be associated with. Changing this creates a new pool. Note: One of LoadbalancerID or ListenerID must be provided.

properties.name: lb_method
properties.description: • lb_method - (Required) The load balancing algorithm to distribute traffic to the pool's members. Must be one of ROUND_ROBIN, LEAST_CONNECTIONS, or SOURCE_IP.

properties.name: persistence
properties.description: • persistence - Omit this field to prevent session persistence. Indicates whether connections in the same session will be processed by the same Pool member or not. Changing this creates a new pool.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the pool. A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).
The persistence argument supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of persistence mode. The current specification supports SOURCE_IP, HTTP_COOKIE, and APP_COOKIE.

properties.name: cookie_name
properties.description: • cookie_name - (Optional) The name of the cookie if persistence mode is set appropriately. Required if type = APP_COOKIE.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: pool_id
properties.description: • pool_id - (Required) The id of the pool that this member will be assigned to.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) The subnet in which to access the member

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Human-readable name for the member.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns the member. Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID other than their own. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) The IP address of the member to receive traffic from the load balancer. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: protocol_port
properties.description: • protocol_port - (Required) The port on which to listen for client traffic. Changing this creates a new member.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: • weight - (Optional) A positive integer value that indicates the relative portion of traffic that this member should receive from the pool. For example, a member with a weight of 10 receives five times as much traffic as a member with a weight of 2.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the member. A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new monitor.

properties.name: pool_id
properties.description: • pool_id - (Required) The id of the pool that this monitor will be assigned to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The Name of the Monitor.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns the monitor. Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID other than their own. Changing this creates a new monitor.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of probe, which is PING, TCP, HTTP, or HTTPS, that is sent by the load balancer to verify the member state. Changing this creates a new monitor.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: • delay - (Required) The time, in seconds, between sending probes to members.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: • timeout - (Required) Maximum number of seconds for a monitor to wait for a ping reply before it times out. The value must be less than the delay value.

properties.name: max_retries
properties.description: • max_retries - (Required) Number of permissible ping failures before changing the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1 and 10..

properties.name: url_path
properties.description: • url_path - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. URI path that will be accessed if monitor type is HTTP or HTTPS.

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: • http_method - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. The HTTP method used for requests by the monitor. If this attribute is not specified, it defaults to "GET".

properties.name: expected_codes
properties.description: • expected_codes - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like "200", or a range like "200-202".

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the monitor. A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new L7 Policy.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns the L7 Policy. Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID other than their own. Changing this creates a new L7 Policy.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Human-readable name for the L7 Policy. Does not have to be unique.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the L7 Policy.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) The L7 Policy action - can either be REDIRECT_TO_POOL, or REDIRECT_TO_LISTENER. Changing this creates a new L7 Policy.

properties.name: listener_id
properties.description: • listener_id - (Required) The Listener on which the L7 Policy will be associated with. Changing this creates a new L7 Policy.

properties.name: position
properties.description: • position - (Optional) The position of this policy on the listener. Positions start at 1. Changing this creates a new L7 Policy.

properties.name: redirect_pool_id
properties.description: • redirect_pool_id - (Optional) Requests matching this policy will be redirected to the pool with this ID. Only valid if action is REDIRECT_TO_POOL.

properties.name: redirect_listener_id
properties.description: • redirect_listener_id - (Optional) Requests matching this policy will be redirected to the listener with this ID. Only valid if action is REDIRECT_TO_LISTENER.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the L7 Policy. This value can only be true (UP).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new L7 Rule.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns the L7 Rule. Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID other than their own. Changing this creates a new L7 Rule.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the L7 Rule.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The L7 Rule type - can either be HOST_NAME or PATH. Changing this creates a new L7 Rule.

properties.name: compare_type
properties.description: • compare_type - (Required) The comparison type for the L7 rule - can either be STARTS_WITH, EQUAL_TO or REGEX

properties.name: l7policy_id
properties.description: • l7policy_id - (Required) The ID of the L7 Policy to query. Changing this creates a new L7 Rule.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The value to use for the comparison. For example, the file type to compare.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Optional) The key to use for the comparison. For example, the name of the cookie to evaluate. Valid when type is set to COOKIE or HEADER. Changing this creates a new L7 Rule.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the L7 Rule. The value can only be true (UP).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a firewall group. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new firewall group.

properties.name: ingress_policy_id
properties.description: • ingress_policy_id - The ingress policy resource id for the firewall group. Changing this updates the ingress_policy_id of an existing firewall group.

properties.name: egress_policy_id
properties.description: • egress_policy_id - The egress policy resource id for the firewall group. Changing this updates the egress_policy_id of an existing firewall group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name for the firewall group. Changing this updates the name of an existing firewall group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description for the firewall group. Changing this updates the description of an existing firewall group.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the firewall group (must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "true"). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing firewall group.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the floating IP. Required if admin wants to create a firewall group for another tenant. Changing this creates a new firewall group.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Optional) Port(s) to associate this firewall group instance with. Must be a list of strings. Changing this updates the associated routers of an existing firewall group.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a firewall policy. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new firewall policy.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name for the firewall policy. Changing this updates the name of an existing firewall policy.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for the firewall policy. Changing this updates the description of an existing firewall policy.

properties.name: rules
properties.description: • rules - (Optional) An array of one or more firewall rules that comprise the policy. Changing this results in adding/removing rules from the existing firewall policy.

properties.name: audited
properties.description: • audited - (Optional) Audit status of the firewall policy (must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "false"). This status is set to "false" whenever the firewall policy or any of its rules are changed. Changing this updates the audited status of an existing firewall policy.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: • shared - (Optional) Sharing status of the firewall policy (must be "true" or "false" if provided). If this is "true" the policy is visible to, and can be used in, firewalls in other tenants. Changing this updates the shared status of an existing firewall policy. Only administrative users can specify if the policy should be shared.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the firewall policy. Required if admin wants to create a firewall policy for another tenant. Changing this creates a new firewall policy.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v2 Networking client. A Compute client is needed to create a firewall rule. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new firewall rule.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the firewall rule. Changing this updates the name of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for the firewall rule. Changing this updates the description of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The protocol type on which the firewall rule operates. Valid values are: tcp, udp, icmp, and any. Changing this updates the protocol of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) Action to be taken ( must be "allow" or "deny") when the firewall rule matches. Changing this updates the action of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: • ip_version - (Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this updates the ip_version of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: source_ip_address
properties.description: • source_ip_address - (Optional) The source IP address on which the firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the source_ip_address of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: destination_ip_address
properties.description: • destination_ip_address - (Optional) The destination IP address on which the firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the destination_ip_address of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: source_port
properties.description: • source_port - (Optional) The source port on which the firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the source_port of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: destination_port
properties.description: • destination_port - (Optional) The destination port on which the firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the destination_port of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Enabled status for the firewall rule (must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "true"). Changing this updates the enabled status of an existing firewall rule.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the firewall rule. Required if admin wants to create a firewall rule for another tenant. Changing this creates a new firewall rule.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Required) Indicates availability zone. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: graph_size_type
properties.description: • graph_size_type - (Required) Indicates the graph size type. 0: indicates 10 thousand edges. 1: indicates 1 million edges. 2: indicates 10 million edges. 3: indicates 100 million edges. 4: indicates 1 billion edges. 5: indicates 10 billion edges. 6: indicates 100 billion edges. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Indicates the graph name. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) Indicates the region code. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) Indicates the security group ID. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Indicates the subnet ID in the specified VPC. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) Indicates the VPC ID. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
<hr/>

properties.name: auto_assign
properties.description: • auto_assign - (Optional) Indicates whether to assign a new eip to the graph automatically. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

properties.name: eip_id
properties.description: • eip_id - (Optional) Indicates the ID of an EIP. Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of agency. The name is a string of 1 to 64 characters.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the agency. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.

properties.name: delegated_domain_name
properties.description: • delegated_domain_name - (Required) The name of delegated domain.

properties.name: project_role
properties.description: • project_role - (Optional) An array of roles and projects which are used to grant permissions to agency on project. The structure is documented below.

properties.name: domain_roles
properties.description: • domain_roles - (optional) An array of role names which stand for the permissionis to be granted to agency on domain.
The project_role block supports:

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Required) The name of project

properties.name: roles
properties.description: • roles - (Required) An array of role names
note: one or both of project_role and domain_roles must be input when creating an agency.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the group.The length is less than or equal to 64 bytes

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the group.

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Optional) The domain this group belongs to.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new User Group.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Required) The group ID of this membership.

properties.name: users
properties.description: • users - (Required) A List of user IDs to associate to the group.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the project. it must start with ID of an existing region_ and be less than or equal to 64 characters. Example: eu-de_project1.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the project.

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Optional) The domain this project belongs to. Changing this creates a new Project.

properties.name: parent_id
properties.description: • parent_id - (Optional) The parent of this project. Changing this creates a new Project.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the IAM client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new Project.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Optional; Required if project_id is empty) The domain to assign the role in.

properties.name: group_id
properties.description: • group_id - (Optional; Required if user_id is empty) The group to assign the role to.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Optional; Required if domain_id is empty) The project to assign the role in.

properties.name: role_id
properties.description: • role_id - (Required) The role to assign.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the user. The user name consists of 5 to 32 characters. It can contain only uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, spaces, and special characters (-_) and cannot start with a digit.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the user.

properties.name: default_project_id
properties.description: • default_project_id - (Optional) The default project this user belongs to.

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Optional) The domain this user belongs to.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Whether the user is enabled or disabled. Valid values are true and false.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) The password for the user. It must contain at least two of the following character types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new User.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: container_format
properties.description: • container_format - (Required) The container format. Must be "bare".

properties.name: disk_format
properties.description: • disk_format - (Required) The disk format. Must be one of "qcow2", "vhd".

properties.name: local_file_path
properties.description: • local_file_path - (Optional) This is the filepath of the raw image file that will be uploaded to Glance. Conflicts with image_source_url.

properties.name: image_cache_path
properties.description: • image_cache_path - (Optional) This is the directory where the images will be downloaded. Images will be stored with a filename corresponding to the url's md5 hash. Defaults to "$HOME/.terraform/image_cache"

properties.name: image_source_url
properties.description: • image_source_url - (Optional) This is the url of the raw image that will be downloaded in the image_cache_path before being uploaded to Glance. Glance is able to download image from internet but the golangsdk library does not yet provide a way to do so. Conflicts with local_file_path.

properties.name: min_disk_gb
properties.description: • min_disk_gb - (Optional) Amount of disk space (in GB) required to boot image. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: min_ram_mb
properties.description: • min_ram_mb - (Optional) Amount of ram (in MB) required to boot image. Defauts to 0.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the image.

properties.name: protected
properties.description: • protected - (Optional) If true, image will not be deletable. Defaults to false.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Glance client. A Glance client is needed to create an Image that can be used with a compute instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new Image.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) The tags of the image. It must be a list of strings. At this time, it is not possible to delete all tags of an image.

properties.name: visibility
properties.description: • visibility - (Optional) The visibility of the image. Must be "private". The ability to set the visibility depends upon the configuration of the HuaweiCloud cloud.
Note: The properties attribute handling in the golangsdk library is currently buggy and needs to be fixed before being implemented in this resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: key_alias
properties.description: • key_alias - (Required) The alias in which to create the key. It is required when we create a new key. Changing this updates the alias of key.

properties.name: key_description
properties.description: • key_description - (Optional) The description of the key as viewed in Huawei console. Changing this updates the description of key.

properties.name: realm
properties.description: • realm - (Optional) Region where a key resides. Changing this creates a new key.

properties.name: pending_days
properties.description: • pending_days - (Optional) Duration in days after which the key is deleted after destruction of the resource, must be between 7 and 1096 days. It doesn't have default value. It only be used when delete a key.

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: • is_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether the key is enabled. Defaults to true. Changing this updates the state of existing key.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: src_node
properties.description: • src_node - (Required) Specifies the source node information.

properties.name: dst_node
properties.description: • dst_node - (Required) Specifies the destination node information.

properties.name: enable_kms
properties.description: • enable_kms - (Required) Specifies whether to use KMS encryption.

properties.name: thread_num
properties.description: • thread_num - (Required) Specifies the number of threads used by the migration task. The value cannot exceed 50.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Specifies tasks description, which cannot exceed 255 characters. The following special characters are not allowed: <>()"&

properties.name: smn_info
properties.description: • smn_info - (Optional) Specifies the field used for sending messages using the Simple Message Notification (SMN) service.
The src_node block supports:

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the region where the source bucket locates.

properties.name: ak
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the source bucket Access Key.

properties.name: sk
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the source bucket Secret Key.

properties.name: object_key
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the object to be selected in the source bucket.

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the source bucket.

properties.name: cloud_type
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the source cloud vendor. Currently only Aliyun and AWS are supported. The default value is Aliyun.
The dst_node block supports:

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the region where the destination bucket locates.

properties.name: ak
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the destination bucket Access Key.

properties.name: sk
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the destination bucket Secret Key.

properties.name: object_key
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the object to be selected in the destination bucket.

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the destination bucket.
The smn_info block supports:

properties.name: topic_urn
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the SMN message topic URN bound to a migration task.

properties.name: language
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the management console language used by the current users. Users can select en-us.

properties.name: trigger_conditions
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the trigger conditions of sending messages using SMN. The value depending on the state of a migration task. The migration task status can be SUCCESS or FAIL.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Required) Instance flavor

properties.name: mrs_cluster
properties.description: • mrs_cluster - (Required) A nested object resource Structure is documented below.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Instance name. A tenant has a unique name of the instance of one type. Value range: An instance name must contain 4 to 64 characters and must start with a letter. The name is case insensitive and contains only letters, digits, and hyphens (-) or underscores (_), excluding other special characters.

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Required) A nested object resource Structure is documented below.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Required) Instance version
The mrs_cluster block supports:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - (Required) MRS cluster ID

properties.name: user_name
properties.description: • user_name - (Optional) MRS cluster username. This parameter is mandatory only when the MRS cluster is in the security mode

properties.name: user_password
properties.description: • user_password - (Optional) Password of the MRS cluster user
The network block supports:

properties.name: available_zone
properties.description: • available_zone - (Required) az

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) ID of the subnet where the instance resides

properties.name: public_ip
properties.description: • public_ip - (Required) A nested object resource Structure is documented below.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Optional) ID of the security group of the instance

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) where the instance resides
The public_ip block supports:

properties.name: bind_type
properties.description: • bind_type - (Required) Bind type. Possible values: auto_assign, not_use

properties.name: eip_id
properties.description: • eip_id - EIP ID. This parameter value is returned only when bindType is set to auto_assign
<hr/>

properties.name: agency
properties.description: - (Optional) Agency name. This parameter is mandatory only when you bind an instance to an elastic IP address (EIP). An instance must be bound to an EIP to grant MLS rights to obtain a tenant's token.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: billing_type
properties.description: • billing_type - (Required) The value is 12, indicating on-demand payment.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) Cluster region information. Obtain the value from Regions and Endpoints.

properties.name: master_node_num
properties.description: • master_node_num - (Required) Number of Master nodes The value is 2.

properties.name: master_node_size
properties.description: • master_node_size - (Required) Best match based on several years of commissioning experience. MRS supports specifications of hosts, and host specifications are determined by CPUs, memory, and disks space. MRS supports instance specifications detailed in MRS specifications

properties.name: core_node_num
properties.description: • core_node_num - (Required) Number of Core nodes Value range: 3 to 100 A maximum of 100 Core nodes are supported by default. If more than 100 Core nodes are required, contact technical support engineers or invoke background APIs to modify the database.

properties.name: core_node_size
properties.description: • core_node_size - (Required) Instance specification of a Core node Configuration method of this parameter is identical to that of master_node_size.

properties.name: available_zone_id
properties.description: • available_zone_id - (Required) ID of an available zone. Obtain the value from Regions and Endpoints. North China AZ1 (cn-north-1a): ae04cf9d61544df3806a3feeb401b204, North China AZ2 (cn-north-1b): d573142f24894ef3bd3664de068b44b0, East China AZ1 (cn-east-2a): 72d50cedc49846b9b42c21495f38d81c, East China AZ2 (cn-east-2b): 38b0f7a602344246bcb0da47b5d548e7, East China AZ3 (cn-east-2c): 5547fd6bf8f84bb5a7f9db062ad3d015, South China AZ1(cn-south-1a): 34f5ff4865cf4ed6b270f15382ebdec5, South China AZ2(cn-south-2b): 043c7e39ecb347a08dc8fcb6c35a274e, South China AZ3(cn-south-1c): af1687643e8c4ec1b34b688e4e3b8901,

properties.name: cluster_name
properties.description: • cluster_name - (Required) Cluster name, which is globally unique and contains only 1 to 64 letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (_).

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) ID of the VPC where the subnet locates Obtain the VPC ID from the management console as follows: Register an account and log in to the management console. Click Virtual Private Cloud and select Virtual Private Cloud from the left list. On the Virtual Private Cloud page, obtain the VPC ID from the list.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Subnet ID Obtain the subnet ID from the management console as follows: Register an account and log in to the management console. Click Virtual Private Cloud and select Virtual Private Cloud from the left list. On the Virtual Private Cloud page, obtain the subnet ID from the list.

properties.name: cluster_version
properties.description: • cluster_version - (Optional) Version of the clusters Currently, MRS 1.6.3, MRS 1.7.2 and MRS 1.8.1 are supported. The latest version of MRS is used by default. Currently, the latest version is MRS 1.8.1.

properties.name: cluster_type
properties.description: • cluster_type - (Optional) Type of clusters 0: analysis cluster 1: streaming cluster The default value is 0.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Required) Type of disks SATA and SSD are supported. SATA: common I/O SSD: super high-speed I/O

properties.name: volume_size
properties.description: • volume_size - (Required) Data disk storage space of a Core node Users can add disks to expand storage capacity when creating a cluster. There are the following scenarios: Separation of data storage and computing: Data is stored in the OBS system. Costs of clusters are relatively low but computing performance is poor. The clusters can be deleted at any time. It is recommended when data computing is not frequently performed. Integration of data storage and computing: Data is stored in the HDFS system. Costs of clusters are relatively high but computing performance is good. The clusters cannot be deleted in a short term. It is recommended when data computing is frequently performed. Value range: 100 GB to 32000 GB

properties.name: node_public_cert_name
properties.description: • node_public_cert_name - (Required) Name of a key pair You can use a key to log in to the Master node in the cluster.

properties.name: safe_mode
properties.description: • safe_mode - (Required) MRS cluster running mode 0: common mode The value indicates that the Kerberos authentication is disabled. Users can use all functions provided by the cluster. 1: safe mode The value indicates that the Kerberos authentication is enabled. Common users cannot use the file management or job management functions of an MRS cluster and cannot view cluster resource usage or the job records of Hadoop and Spark. To use these functions, the users must obtain the relevant permissions from the MRS Manager administrator. The request has the cluster_admin_secret parameter only when safe_mode is set to 1.

properties.name: cluster_admin_secret
properties.description: • cluster_admin_secret - (Optional) Indicates the password of the MRS Manager administrator. The password for MRS 1.5.0: Must contain 6 to 32 characters. Must contain at least two types of the following: Lowercase letters Uppercase letters Digits Special characters of ~!@#$%^&*()-_=+\|[{}];:'",<.>/? Spaces Must be different from the username. Must be different from the username written in reverse order. The password for MRS 1.3.0: Must contain 8 to 64 characters. Must contain at least four types of the following: Lowercase letters Uppercase letters Digits Special characters of~!@#$%&*()-_=+|[{}];:'",<.>/? Spaces Must be different from the username. Must be different from the username written in reverse order. This parameter needs to be configured only when safe_mode is set to 1.

properties.name: log_collection
properties.description: • log_collection - (Optional) Indicates whether logs are collected when cluster installation fails. 0: not collected 1: collected The default value is 0. If log_collection is set to 1, OBS buckets will be created to collect the MRS logs. These buckets will be charged.

properties.name: component_list
properties.description: • component_list - (Required) Service component list.

properties.name: add_jobs
properties.description: • add_jobs - (Optional) You can submit a job when you create a cluster to save time and use MRS easily. Only one job can be added.
The component_list block supports:

properties.name: component_name
properties.description: (Required) Component name Currently, Hadoop, Spark, HBase, Hive, Hue, Loader, Flume, Kafka and Storm are supported.

The add_jobs block supports: * job_type - (Required) Job type 1: MapReduce 2: Spark 3: Hive Script 4: HiveQL (not supported currently) 5: DistCp, importing and exporting data (not supported in this API currently). 6: Spark Script 7: Spark SQL, submitting Spark SQL statements (not supported in this API currently). NOTE: Spark and Hive jobs can be added to only clusters including Spark and Hive components.

properties.name: job_name
properties.description: • job_name - (Required) Job name It contains only 1 to 64 letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (_). NOTE: Identical job names are allowed but not recommended.

properties.name: jar_path
properties.description: • jar_path - (Required) Path of the .jar file or .sql file for program execution The parameter must meet the following requirements: Contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&><'$. The address cannot be empty or full of spaces. Starts with / or s3a://. Spark Script must end with .sql; while MapReduce and Spark Jar must end with .jar. sql and jar are case-insensitive.

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: • arguments - (Optional) Key parameter for program execution The parameter is specified by the function of the user's program. MRS is only responsible for loading the parameter. The parameter contains a maximum of 2047 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

properties.name: input
properties.description: • input - (Optional) Path for inputting data, which must start with / or s3a://. A correct OBS path is required. The parameter contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

properties.name: output
properties.description: • output - (Optional) Path for outputting data, which must start with / or s3a://. A correct OBS path is required. If the path does not exist, the system automatically creates it. The parameter contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

properties.name: job_log
properties.description: • job_log - (Optional) Path for storing job logs that record job running status. This path must start with / or s3a://. A correct OBS path is required. The parameter contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

properties.name: shutdown_cluster
properties.description: • shutdown_cluster - (Optional) Whether to delete the cluster after the jobs are complete true: Yes false: No

properties.name: file_action
properties.description: • file_action - (Optional) Data import and export import export

properties.name: submit_job_once_cluster_run
properties.description: • submit_job_once_cluster_run - (Required) true: A job is submitted when a cluster is created. false: A job is submitted separately. The parameter is set to true in this example.

properties.name: hql
properties.description: • hql - (Optional) HiveQL statement

properties.name: hive_script_path
properties.description: • hive_script_path - (Optional) SQL program path This parameter is needed by Spark Script and Hive Script jobs only and must meet the following requirements: Contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&><'$. The address cannot be empty or full of spaces. Starts with / or s3a://. Ends with .sql. sql is case-insensitive.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: job_type
properties.description: • job_type - (Required) Job type 1: MapReduce 2: Spark 3: Hive Script 4: HiveQL (not supported currently) 5: DistCp, importing and exporting data. 6: Spark Script 7: Spark SQL, submitting Spark SQL statements. (not supported in this APIcurrently) NOTE: Spark and Hive jobs can be added to only clusters including Spark and Hive components.

properties.name: job_name
properties.description: • job_name - (Required) Job name Contains only 1 to 64 letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (_). NOTE: Identical job names are allowed but not recommended.

properties.name: cluster_id
properties.description: • cluster_id - (Required) Cluster ID

properties.name: jar_path
properties.description: • jar_path - (Required) Path of the .jar package or .sql file for program execution The parameter must meet the following requirements: Contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&><'$. The address cannot be empty or full of spaces. Starts with / or s3a://. Spark Script must end with .sql; while MapReduce and Spark Jar must end with .jar. sql and jar are case-insensitive.

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: • arguments - (Optional) Key parameter for program execution. The parameter is specified by the function of the user's program. MRS is only responsible for loading the parameter. The parameter contains a maximum of 2047 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

properties.name: input
properties.description: • input - (Optional) Path for inputting data, which must start with / or s3a://. A correct OBS path is required. The parameter contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

properties.name: output
properties.description: • output - (Optional) Path for outputting data, which must start with / or s3a://. A correct OBS path is required. If the path does not exist, the system automatically creates it. The parameter contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

properties.name: job_log
properties.description: • job_log - (Optional) Path for storing job logs that record job running status. This path must start with / or s3a://. A correct OBS path is required. The parameter contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

properties.name: hive_script_path
properties.description: • hive_script_path - (Optional) SQL program path This parameter is needed by Spark Script and Hive Script jobs only and must meet the following requirements: Contains a maximum of 1023 characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&><'$. The address cannot be empty or full of spaces. Starts with / or s3a://. Ends with .sql. sql is case-insensitive.

properties.name: is_protected
properties.description: • is_protected - (Optional) Whether a job is protected true false The current version does not support this function.

properties.name: is_public
properties.description: • is_public - (Optional) Whether a job is public true false The current version does not support this function.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 nat client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new nat gateway.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the nat gateway.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the nat gateway.

properties.name: spec
properties.description: • spec - (Required) The specification of the nat gateway, valid values are "1", "2", "3", "4".

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The target tenant ID in which to allocate the nat gateway. Changing this creates a new nat gateway.

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) ID of the router this nat gateway belongs to. Changing this creates a new nat gateway.

properties.name: internal_network_id
properties.description: • internal_network_id - (Optional) ID of the network this nat gateway connects to. Changing this creates a new nat gateway.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 nat client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new snat rule.

properties.name: nat_gateway_id
properties.description: • nat_gateway_id - (Required) ID of the nat gateway this snat rule belongs to. Changing this creates a new snat rule.

properties.name: network_id

A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

properties.name: pool
properties.description: • pool - (Optional) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating IP. Only admin_external_net is valid. Changing this creates a new floating IP.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Optional) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to associate with this floating IP.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The target tenant ID in which to allocate the floating IP, if you specify this together with a port_id, make sure the target port belongs to the same tenant. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address)

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - Fixed IP of the port to associate with this floating IP. Required if the port has multiple fixed IPs.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

properties.name: floating_ip
properties.description: • floating_ip - (Required) IP Address of an existing floating IP.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Required) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to associate with this floating IP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron network. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new network.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the network. Changing this updates the name of the existing network.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: • shared - (Optional) Specifies whether the network resource can be accessed by any tenant or not. Changing this updates the sharing capabalities of the existing network.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the network. Required if admin wants to create a network for another tenant. Changing this creates a new network.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the network. Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the state of the existing network.

properties.name: segments
properties.description: • segments - (Optional) An array of one or more provider segment objects.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: availability_zone_hints
properties.description: • availability_zone_hints - (Optional) An availability zone is used to make network resources highly available. Used for resources with high availability so that they are scheduled on different availability zones. Changing this creates a new network.
The segments block supports:

properties.name: physical_network
properties.description: The phisical network where this network is implemented.

properties.name: segmentation_id
properties.description: An isolated segment on the physical network.

properties.name: network_type
properties.description: The type of physical network.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the port. Changing this updates the name of an existing port.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The ID of the network to attach the port to. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the port (must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing port.

properties.name: mac_address
properties.description: • mac_address - (Optional) Specify a specific MAC address for the port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the Port. Required if admin wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: device_owner
properties.description: • device_owner - (Optional) The device owner of the Port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: security_group_ids
properties.description: • security_group_ids - (Optional - Conflicts with no_security_groups) A list of security group IDs to apply to the port. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).

properties.name: no_security_groups
properties.description: • no_security_groups - (Optional - Conflicts with security_group_ids) If set to true, then no security groups are applied to the port. If set to false and no security_group_ids are specified, then the Port will yield to the default behavior of the Networking service, which is to usually apply the "default" security group.

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: • device_id - (Optional) The ID of the device attached to the port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - (Optional) An array of desired IPs for this port. The structure is described below.

properties.name: allowed_address_pairs
properties.description: • allowed_address_pairs - (Optional) An IP/MAC Address pair of additional IP addresses that can be active on this port. The structure is described below.

properties.name: extra_dhcp_option
properties.description: • extra_dhcp_option - (Optional) An extra DHCP option that needs to be configured on the port. The structure is described below. Can be specified multiple times.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The fixed_ip block supports:

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Subnet in which to allocate IP address for this port.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) IP address desired in the subnet for this port. If you don't specify ip_address, an available IP address from the specified subnet will be allocated to this port. This field will not be populated if it is left blank. To retrieve the assigned IP address, use the all_fixed_ips attribute.
The allowed_address_pairs block supports:

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Required) The additional IP address.

properties.name: mac_address
properties.description: • mac_address - (Optional) The additional MAC address.
The extra_dhcp_option block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the DHCP option.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Value of the DHCP option.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: • ip_version - (Optional) IP protocol version. Defaults to 4.

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) ID of the router this interface belongs to. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - ID of the subnet this interface connects to. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - ID of the port this interface connects to. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) ID of the router this routing entry belongs to. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: destination_cidr
properties.description: • destination_cidr - (Required) CIDR block to match on the packet’s destination IP. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: next_hop
properties.description: • next_hop - (Required) IP address of the next hop gateway. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a router. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new router.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the router. Changing this updates the name of an existing router.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the router (must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing router.

properties.name: distributed
properties.description: • distributed - (Optional) Indicates whether or not to create a distributed router. The default policy setting in Neutron restricts usage of this property to administrative users only.

properties.name: external_network_id
properties.description: • external_network_id - (Optional) The network UUID of an external gateway for the router. A router with an external gateway is required if any compute instances or load balancers will be using floating IPs. Changing this updates the external gateway of the router.

properties.name: enable_snat
properties.description: • enable_snat - (Optional) Enable Source NAT for the router. Valid values are "true" or "false". An external_network_id has to be set in order to set this property. Changing this updates the enable_snat of the router.

properties.name: external_fixed_ip
properties.description: • external_fixed_ip - (Optional) An external fixed IP for the router. This can be repeated. The structure is described below. An external_network_id has to be set in order to set this property. Changing this updates the external fixed IPs of the router.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the floating IP. Required if admin wants to create a router for another tenant. Changing this creates a new router.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional driver-specific options.

properties.name: availability_zone_hints
properties.description: • availability_zone_hints - (Optional) An availability zone is used to make network resources highly available. Used for resources with high availability so that they are scheduled on different availability zones. Changing this creates a new router.

properties.name: subnet_id

properties.name: network_id

properties.name: cidr

properties.name: tenant_id

properties.name: gateway_ip
properties.description: • gateway_ip - (Optional) Default gateway used by devices in this subnet. Leaving this blank and not setting no_gateway will cause a default gateway of .1 to be used. Changing this updates the gateway IP of the existing subnet.

properties.name: no_gateway
properties.description: • no_gateway - (Optional) Do not set a gateway IP on this subnet. Changing this removes or adds a default gateway IP of the existing subnet.

properties.name: enable_dhcp

properties.name: removing-huaweicloud_vpc_peering_connection_accepter_v2-from-your-configuration
properties.description: » Removing huaweicloud_vpc_peering_connection_accepter_v2 from your configuration

huaweicloud allows a cross-tenant VPC Peering Connection to be deleted from either the requester's or accepter's side. However, Terraform only allows the VPC Peering Connection to be deleted from the requester's side by removing the corresponding huaweicloud_vpc_peering_connection_v2 resource from your configuration. Removing a huaweicloud_vpc_peering_connection_accepter_v2 resource from your configuration will remove it from your state file and management, but will not destroy the VPC Peering Connection.

properties.description: • display_name - (Optional) Topic display name, which is presented as the name of the email sender in an email message.

properties.name: topic_urn
properties.description: • topic_urn - (Optional) Resource identifier of a topic, which is unique.

properties.name: push_policy
properties.description: • push_policy - (Optional) Message pushing policy. 0 indicates that the message sending fails and the message is cached in the queue. 1 indicates that the failed message is discarded.

properties.name: create_time
properties.description: • create_time - (Optional) Time when the topic was created.

properties.name: update_time
properties.description: • update_time - (Optional) Time when the topic was updated.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name (Required) - Specifies the policy name. The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters that can contain letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). It cannot start with default.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: • start_time (Required) - Specifies the start time of the backup job.The value is in the HH:mm format.

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status (Required) - Specifies the backup policy status. The value can ON or OFF.

properties.name: retain_first_backup
properties.description: • retain_first_backup (Required) - Specifies whether to retain the first backup in the current month. Possible values are Y or N.

properties.name: rentention_num
properties.description: • rentention_num (Required) - Specifies number of retained backups. Minimum value is 2.

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: • frequency (Required) - Specifies the backup interval. The value is in the range of 1 to 14 days.
tags - (Optional) Represents the list of tags to be configured for the backup policy.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Required) Specifies the tag key. A tag key consists of up to 36 characters, chosen from letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (_).

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the tag value. A tag value consists of 0 to 43 characters, chosen from letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (_).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the vbs backup. Changing the parameter creates a new backup.

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: • volume_id - (Required) The id of the disk to be backed up. Changing the parameter creates a new backup.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot id of the disk to be backed up. Changing the parameter creates a new backup.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the vbs backup. Changing the parameter creates a new backup.
tags - (Optional) List of tags to be configured for the backup resources. Changing the parameter creates a new backup.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Required) Specifies the tag key. Changing the parameter creates a new backup

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the tag value. Changing the parameter creates a new backup
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an IPSec policy. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new policy.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the policy. Changing this updates the name of the existing policy.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the policy. Required if admin wants to create a policy for another project. Changing this creates a new policy.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the policy. Changing this updates the description of the existing policy.

properties.name: auth_algorithm
properties.description: • auth_algorithm - (Optional) The authentication hash algorithm. Valid values are md5, sha1, sha2-256, sha2-384, sha2-512. Default is sha1. Changing this updates the algorithm of the existing policy.

properties.name: encapsulation_mode
properties.description: • encapsulation_mode - (Optional) The encapsulation mode. Valid values are tunnel and transport. Default is tunnel. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: encryption_algorithm
properties.description: • encryption_algorithm - (Optional) The encryption algorithm. Valid values are 3des, aes-128, aes-192 and so on. The default value is aes-128. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: pfs
properties.description: • pfs - (Optional) The perfect forward secrecy mode. Valid values are Group2, Group5 and Group14. Default is Group5. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: transform_protocol
properties.description: • transform_protocol - (Optional) The transform protocol. Valid values are ESP, AH and AH-ESP. Changing this updates the existing policy. Default is ESP.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: lifetime - (Optional) The lifetime of the security association. Consists of Unit and Value.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: (Optional) The units for the lifetime of the security association. Can be either seconds or kilobytes. Default is seconds.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) The value for the lifetime of the security association. Must be a positive integer. Default is 3600.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an endpoint group. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the group. Changing this updates the name of the existing group.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the group. Required if admin wants to create an endpoint group for another project. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the group. Changing this updates the description of the existing group.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - The type of the endpoints in the group. A valid value is subnet, cidr, network, router, or vlan. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: endpoints
properties.description: • endpoints - List of endpoints of the same type, for the endpoint group. The values will depend on the type. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: value_specs

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create an IPSec site connection. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new site connection.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the connection. Changing this updates the name of the existing connection.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the connection. Required if admin wants to create a connection for another project. Changing this creates a new connection.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The human-readable description for the connection. Changing this updates the description of the existing connection.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the resource. Can either be up(true) or down(false). Changing this updates the administrative state of the existing connection.

properties.name: ikepolicy_id
properties.description: • ikepolicy_id - (Required) The ID of the IKE policy. Changing this creates a new connection.

properties.name: vpnservice_id
properties.description: • vpnservice_id - (Required) The ID of the VPN service. Changing this creates a new connection.

properties.name: local_ep_group_id
properties.description: • local_ep_group_id - (Optional) The ID for the endpoint group that contains private subnets for the local side of the connection. You must specify this parameter with the peer_ep_group_id parameter unless in backward- compatible mode where peer_cidrs is provided with a subnet_id for the VPN service. Changing this updates the existing connection.

properties.name: ipsecpolicy_id
properties.description: • ipsecpolicy_id - (Required) The ID of the IPsec policy. Changing this creates a new connection.

properties.name: peer_id
properties.description: • peer_id - (Required) The peer router identity for authentication. A valid value is an IPv4 address, IPv6 address, e-mail address, key ID, or FQDN. Typically, this value matches the peer_address value. Changing this updates the existing policy.

properties.name: peer_ep_group_id
properties.description: • peer_ep_group_id - (Optional) The ID for the endpoint group that contains private CIDRs in the form < net_address > / < prefix > for the peer side of the connection. You must specify this parameter with the local_ep_group_id parameter unless in backward-compatible mode where peer_cidrs is provided with a subnet_id for the VPN service.

properties.name: local_id
properties.description: • local_id - (Optional) An ID to be used instead of the external IP address for a virtual router used in traffic between instances on different networks in east-west traffic. Most often, local ID would be domain name, email address, etc. If this is not configured then the external IP address will be used as the ID.

properties.name: peer_address
properties.description: • peer_address - (Required) The peer gateway public IPv4 or IPv6 address or FQDN.

properties.name: psk
properties.description: • psk - (Required) The pre-shared key. A valid value is any string.

properties.name: initiator
properties.description: • initiator - (Optional) A valid value is response-only or bi-directional. Default is bi-directional.

properties.name: peer_cidrs
properties.description: • peer_cidrs - (Optional) Unique list of valid peer private CIDRs in the form < net_address > / < prefix > .

properties.name: list description
properties.description: dpd - (Optional) A dictionary with dead peer detection (DPD) protocol controls.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) action. A valid value is clear, hold, restart, disabled, or restart-by-peer. Default value is hold.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) timeout in seconds. A valid value is a positive integer that is greater than the DPD interval value. Default is 120.

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) interval, in seconds. A valid value is a positive integer. Default is 30.

properties.name: mtu
properties.description: • mtu - (Optional) The maximum transmission unit (MTU) value to address fragmentation. Minimum value is 68 for IPv4, and 1280 for IPv6.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
